basics.name: Peter Fullmer
basics.label: Full-Stack Web/App Developer
basics.summary: Full-Stack Web/App Developer, utilizing years of programming experience to create cutting-edge solutions to modern-day problems.

work.name: Hanai Project
work.summary: Working as head developer to create a cutting-edge, AI-powered family history mobile app. Utilizing Expo Go (React Native), AWS Amplify, AWS DynamoDB, AWS S3, AWS Transcribe, AWS RDS, Cloudflare, Node.js, and Serverless.js.
highlights: Created the app
Developed the app until its release

work.name: BYU Law School - Development
work.summary:
Working primarily as backend developer to create and optimize services used at the law school. Utilizing Node.js, Serverless.js, MySQL, AWS DynamoDB, AWS S3, etc. 

Managing the law info website, which allows faculty and students to register for classes, see progress reports, enter and release grades, and view student and faculty directories. 

Created the law media website, which allows faculty to upload class recordings and share them with students individually or in groups. Utilizing AWS Elemental MediaConvert to allow video streaming, AWS Transcribe to provide captions and transcriptions of each lecture, and React.js with Material UI to develop the frontend.
highlights: Created Media Sharing Website (AWS MediaConvert, AWS Transcribe, AWS S3, etc.)
Wrote many mocha unit tests
Refactored Organization's repositories
Helped to create the law school's main website using Strapi

work.name: BYU Law School - Media Services
work.summary:
Collaborating with a team of eight student developers to manage class recordings used by law personnel.

Oversaw the production and broadcasting of weekly devotionals.
highlights: Worked with faculty members to fix and set up equipment for lectures
Managed requests to access recordings
Archived recordings in an organized file system

volunteer.organization: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
volunteer.summary: Worked as a Missionary to help people improve their lives both physically and spiritually. Served in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, and Eugene Oregon, United States.
highlights: Planned and carried out hundreds of service projects
Learned to effectively listen and communicate
Learned Spanish in an immersive environment

courses: Completed | - | CS 142 | Intro to Computer Programming
Completed | - | CS 224 | Introduction to Computer Systems
Completed | - | CS 252 | Intro to Computational Theory
Completed | - | CS 235 | Data Structures and Algorithms
Completed | - | CS 312 | Algorithm Design and Analysis

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: Earned the rank of Eagle Scout

references.reference:
"It is with great pleasure that I recommend Peter Fullmer with my greatest confidence in their software development abilities. During the winter of 2023 Peter was enrolled in my course on Web Programming. Peter fully engaged in the coursework and produced mastery projects that went well above the expected quality produced by the rest of the class. Peter demonstrated mastery of building UI applications with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and common web frameworks.
To support the front-end, Peter built complex back-end REST services powered by a cloud hosted database. This was all served up using their extensive knowledge of HTTP over TLS from servers that Peter managed.

"The culmination of Peterâ€™s work was a capstone project that represented a full technology stack.
In competition with a class of hundreds of students, Peter placed first and earned the coveted Ghirardelli award.

"I heartily encourage you to give Peter Fullmer full consideration as Peter has not only the technical skills necessary to thrive in your organization, but Peter is easy to work with and would make a great member of any team. Please contact me if you have any questions concerning this recommendation."

projects.name: AI Drawing Game
projects.description: Developed an AI-powered, cross-platform multiplayer drawing game utilizing WebSocket, React.js and Node.js
highlights: Won 1st place against ~40 other projects

projects.name: Tank Game
projects.description: Developed a multiplayer battle royale tank game with smart NPCs and various tank classes.
highlights: NPCs use dijkstra's algorithm to pathfind to the player
The Menus were made using my own menu engine
Inspired by the tank game from Wii Play

projects.name: Physics Engine
projects.description: Developed a physics engine complete with circuits, newtonian gravity, conservation of energy, sound waves, etc.
highlights: Collisions and basic gravity are handled by Gamemaker's built-in physics engine
Used actual physics equations for newtonian gravity
Inspired by Soup Toys and Powder Toy
This was my final project in my high school physics class

projects.name: Game Jam - Stealth Game
projects.description: Developed a stealth game with raytracing, pathfinding, and NPCs that patrol and chase the player.
highlights: Won the game jam (it was with a group of five friends)
Used binary search for raytracing
Heavy usage of trigonometry for smooth gameplay
Completed in 24 hours
